member.name: E:R2API.AssetAPI.AssetLoaderReady
member.summary: This event is invoked as soon as the AssetAPI is loaded. This is the perfect time to add assets to the Master and Object Catalogs in the API.

member.name: P:R2API.AssetAPI.DoneLoading
member.summary: Returns true once assets have been loaded.

member.name: P:R2API.AssetAPI.MasterCatalog
member.summary: List of all character masters, including both vanilla and modded ones.

member.name: F:R2API.AssetAPI.BodyCatalog
member.summary: List of all character bodies, including both vanilla and modded ones.

member.name: F:R2API.AssetAPI._bodyCatalogReady
member.summary: If BodyCatalog.Init was called already.

member.name: E:R2API.AssetAPI.OnBodyCatalogReady
member.summary: Invokes just before BodyCatalog.Init - EventArgs is AssetAPI.BodyCatalog.

member.name: M:R2API.AssetAPI.AddToBodyCatalog(UnityEngine.GameObject,UnityEngine.Texture2D)
member.summary: Add a BodyPrefab to RoR2.BodyCatalog, even after init. If you try to add a BodyPrefab whose name already exists in nameToIndexMap, this method will throw.
member.returns: The index of your BodyPrefab.

member.name: T:R2API.AssetBundleResourcesProvider
member.summary: This class provides a wrapper around an AssetBundle for integrating it into the regular Unity Resources library

members.member:
Simple class for adding all the individual of AssetPlus together

member.summary: for adding an TMP_FontAsset directly

member.name: T:R2API.AssetPlus.SoundBanks
member.summary: class for SoundBanks to load

member.name: M:R2API.AssetPlus.SoundBanks.Add(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Adds a soundbank to load, returns the ID used for unloading
member.param: byte array of the entire .bnk file

member.name: M:R2API.AssetPlus.SoundBanks.Add(System.String)
member.summary: Adds an external soundbank to load, returns the ID used for unloading (.sound files are loaded automatically)
member.param: the absolute path to the file

member.name: M:R2API.AssetPlus.SoundBanks.Remove(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Unloads an bank using the ID (ID is returned at the Add() of the bank)
member.param: BankID

member.name: M:R2API.BuffAPI.Add(R2API.CustomBuff)
member.summary: Add a custom buff to the list of available buffs. Value for BuffDef.buffIndex can be ignored. If this is called after the BuffCatalog inits then this will return false and ignore the custom buff.
member.param: The buff to add.
member.returns: the BuffIndex of your item if added. -1 otherwise

member.name: T:R2API.CustomBuff
member.summary: Class that defines a custom buff type for use in the game; you may omit the buffIndex in the BuffDef, as that will be assigned by the API. If you are doing a buff for a custom elite, don't forget to register your CustomElite before too to fill the eliteIndex field !

member.name: F:R2API.CustomBuff.BuffDef
member.summary: Definition of the Buff

member.name: M:R2API.CustomBuff.#ctor(System.String,System.String,UnityEngine.Color,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: you may omit the buffIndex in the BuffDef, as that will be assigned by the API. If you are doing a buff for a custom elite, don't forget to register your CustomElite before too to fill the eliteIndex field !

member.name: M:R2API.CustomBuff.#ctor(RoR2.BuffDef)
member.summary: you may omit the buffIndex in the BuffDef, as that will be assigned by the API. If you are doing a buff for a custom elite, don't forget to register your CustomElite before too to fill the eliteIndex field !

member.name: M:R2API.DifficultyAPI.AddDifficulty(RoR2.DifficultyDef)
member.summary: Add a DifficultyDef to the list of available difficulties. This must be called before the DifficultyCatalog inits, so before plugin.Start() You'll get your new index returned that you can work with for comparing to Run.Instance.selectedDifficulty. If this is called after the DifficultyCatalog inits then this will return -1/DifficultyIndex.Invalid and ignore the difficulty
member.param: The difficulty to add.
member.returns: DifficultyIndex.Invalid if it fails. Your index otherwise.

member.name: P:R2API.DirectorAPI.Loaded
member.summary: Return true if the submodule is loaded.

member.name: E:R2API.DirectorAPI.StageSettingsActions
member.summary: Event used to edit stage settings.

member.name: E:R2API.DirectorAPI.MonsterActions
member.summary: Event used to edit/add/remove the monsters spawned on a stage.

member.name: E:R2API.DirectorAPI.InteractableActions
member.summary: Event used to edit/add/remove interactables spawned on a stage.

member.name: E:R2API.DirectorAPI.FamilyActions
member.summary: Event used to edit/add/remove monster families on a stage.

member.name: T:R2API.DirectorAPI.MonsterCategory
member.summary: If this is called then DirectorAPI will hook ClassicStageInfo.Awake and use the events to make changes
The three categories for monsters. Support for custom categories will come later.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.MonsterCategory.None
member.summary: An invalid default value. Anything with this value is ignored when dealing with monsters.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.MonsterCategory.BasicMonsters
member.summary: Small enemies like Lemurians and Beetles.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.MonsterCategory.Minibosses
member.summary: Medium enemies like Golems and Beetle Guards.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.MonsterCategory.Champions
member.summary: Bosses like Vagrants and Titans.

member.name: T:R2API.DirectorAPI.InteractableCategory
member.summary: The categories for interactables. Support for custom categories will come later.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.InteractableCategory.None
member.summary: An invalid default value. Anything with this value is ignored when dealing with interactables.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.InteractableCategory.Chests
member.summary: Chests, such as basic chests, large chests, shops, equipment barrels, lunar pods, and category chests. NOT legendary chests or cloaked chests.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.InteractableCategory.Barrels
member.summary: Barrels.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.InteractableCategory.Shrines
member.summary: Chance shrines, blood shrines, combat shrines, order shrines, mountain shrines, shrine of the woods. NOT shrine of gold.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.InteractableCategory.Drones
member.summary: All types of drones such as TC-280, equipment drones, gunner drones, healing drones, and incinerator drones. NOT gunner turrets.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.InteractableCategory.Misc
member.summary: Gunner turrets only.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.InteractableCategory.Rare
member.summary: Legendary chests, cloaked chests, shrine of gold, and radio scanners.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.InteractableCategory.Duplicator
member.summary: All three tiers of printers.

member.name: T:R2API.DirectorAPI.Stage
member.summary: A flags enum for the vanilla stages. Custom stages are handled with a string in StageInfo.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.Stage.Custom
member.summary: When this is set to custom, check the string in StageInfo

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.StageInfo.stage
member.summary: The current stage. If set to custom, check customStageName.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.StageInfo.CustomStageName
member.summary: This is set to the name of the custom stage. Is left blank for vanilla stages.

member.name: M:R2API.DirectorAPI.StageInfo.CheckStage(R2API.DirectorAPI.Stage,System.String[])
member.summary: Returns true if the current stage matches any of the stages you specify. To match a custom stage, include Stage.Custom in your stage input and specify names in customStageNames.
member.param: The stages to match with
Names of the custom stages to match. Leave blank to match all custom stages

member.name: T:R2API.DirectorAPI.StageSettings
member.summary: A class passed to everything subscribed to stageSettingsActions that contains various settings for a stage. All mods will be working off the same settings, so operators like *=,+=,-=, and /= are preferred over directly setting values.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.StageSettings.SceneDirectorMonsterCredits
member.summary: How many credits the scene director has for monsters at the start of a stage. This scales with difficulty, and thus will always be zero on the first stage.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.StageSettings.SceneDirectorInteractableCredits
member.summary: How many credits the scene director has for interactables at the start of a stage.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.StageSettings.BonusCreditObjects
member.summary: If the GameObject key of the dictionary is enabled, then the scene director gains the value in extra interactable credits Used for things like the door in Abyssal Depths.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.StageSettings.MonsterCategoryWeights
member.summary: The weights for each monster category on this stage.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.StageSettings.InteractableCategoryWeights
member.summary: The weights for each interactable category on this stage.

member.name: T:R2API.DirectorAPI.DirectorCardHolder
member.summary: A wrapper class for DirectorCards. A list of these is passed to everything subscribed to monsterActions and interactableActions.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.DirectorCardHolder.Card
member.summary: The director card. This contains the majority of the information for an interactable or monster, including the prefab.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.DirectorCardHolder.MonsterCategory
member.summary: The monster category the card belongs to. Will be set to None for interactables.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.DirectorCardHolder.InteractableCategory
member.summary: The interactable category the card belongs to. Will be set to none for monsters.

member.name: T:R2API.DirectorAPI.MonsterFamilyHolder
member.summary: A wrapper class for Monster Families. A list of these is passed to everything subscribed to familyActions.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.MonsterFamilyHolder.FamilyBasicMonsters
member.summary: List of all basic monsters that can spawn during this family event.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.MonsterFamilyHolder.FamilyMinibosses
member.summary: List of all minibosses that can spawn during this family event.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.MonsterFamilyHolder.FamilyChampions
member.summary: List of all champions that can spawn during this family event.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.MonsterFamilyHolder.FamilyBasicMonsterWeight
member.summary: The selection weight for basic monsters during the family event.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.MonsterFamilyHolder.FamilyMinibossWeight
member.summary: The selection weight for minibosses during the family event.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.MonsterFamilyHolder.FamilyChampionWeight
member.summary: The selection weight for champions during the family event.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.MonsterFamilyHolder.MinStageCompletion
member.summary: The minimum number of stages completed for this family event to occur.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.MonsterFamilyHolder.MaxStageCompletion
member.summary: The maximum number of stages for this family event to occur.

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.MonsterFamilyHolder.FamilySelectionWeight
member.summary: The weight of this monster family relative to other monster families. Does NOT increase the chances of a family event occuring, just the chance that this will be chosen when one does occur. Support for modifying the chance of family events overall will come later (and will be in StageSettings)

member.name: F:R2API.DirectorAPI.MonsterFamilyHolder.SelectionChatString
member.summary: The message sent to chat when this family is selected.

member.name: T:R2API.DirectorAPI.Helpers
member.summary: This subclass contains helper methods for use with DirectorAPI. Note that there is much more flexibility by working with the API directly through its event system. The primary purpose of these helpers is to serve as example code, and to assist with very simple tasks. They are NOT intended to be, or ever will be, a comprehensive way to use the DirectorAPI.

member.name: T:R2API.DirectorAPI.Helpers.MonsterNames
member.summary: This class contains static strings for each characterspawncard in the base game. These can be used for matching names.

member.name: T:R2API.DirectorAPI.Helpers.InteractableNames
member.summary: This class contains static strings for each interactablespawncard in the base game. These can be used for matching names.

member.name: M:R2API.DirectorAPI.Helpers.PreventElites(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables elite spawns for a specific monster.
member.param: The name of the monster to edit
Should elites be allowed?

member.name: M:R2API.DirectorAPI.Helpers.AddNewMonster(RoR2.DirectorCard,R2API.DirectorAPI.MonsterCategory)
member.summary: Adds a new monster to all stages.
member.param: The DirectorCard for the monster
The category to add the monster to

member.name: M:R2API.DirectorAPI.Helpers.AddNewMonsterToStage(RoR2.DirectorCard,R2API.DirectorAPI.MonsterCategory,R2API.DirectorAPI.Stage,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new monster to a specific stage. For custom stages use Stage.Custom and enter the name of the stage in customStageName.
member.param: The DirectorCard of the monster to add
The category to add the monster to
The stage to add the monster to
The name of the custom stage

member.summary: Adds a new interactable to all stages.
member.param: The DirectorCard for the interactable
The category of the interactable

member.name: M:R2API.DirectorAPI.Helpers.AddNewInteractableToStage(RoR2.DirectorCard,R2API.DirectorAPI.InteractableCategory,R2API.DirectorAPI.Stage,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new interactable to a specific stage. For custom stages use Stage.Custom and enter the name of the stage in customStageName.
member.param: The DirectorCard of the interactable
The category of the interactable
The stage to add the interactable to
The name of the custom stage

member.name: M:R2API.DirectorAPI.Helpers.RemoveExistingMonster(System.String)
member.summary: Removes a monster from spawns on all stages.
member.param: The name of the monster card to remove

member.name: M:R2API.DirectorAPI.Helpers.RemoveExistingMonsterFromStage(System.String,R2API.DirectorAPI.Stage,System.String)
member.summary: Removes a monster from spawns on a specific stage. For custom stages use Stage.Custom and enter the name of the stage in customStageName.
member.param: The name of the monster card to remove
The stage to remove on
The name of the custom stage

member.name: M:R2API.DirectorAPI.Helpers.RemoveExistingInteractable(System.String)
member.summary: Remove an interactable from spawns on all stages.
member.param: Name of the interactable to remove

member.name: M:R2API.DirectorAPI.Helpers.RemoveExistingInteractableFromStage(System.String,R2API.DirectorAPI.Stage,System.String)
member.summary: Remove an interactable from spawns on a specific stage. For custom stages use Stage.Custom and enter the name of the stage in customStageName.
member.param: The name of the interactable to remove
The stage to remove on
The name of the custom stage

member.summary: Adds a flat amount of monster credits to the scene director on a specific stage. For custom stages use Stage.Custom and enter the name of the stage in customStageName.

member.name: P:R2API.EffectAPI.Loaded
member.summary: Return true if the submodule is loaded.

member.name: E:R2API.EffectAPI.GetAdditionalEntries
member.summary: Mimics events found in CatalogModHelpers, can be used to add or sort effects.

member.name: M:R2API.EffectAPI.AddEffect(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Creates an EffectDef from a prefab and adds it to the EffectCatalog. The prefab must have an the following components: EffectComponent, VFXAttributes For more control over the EffectDef, use AddEffect(EffectDef)
member.param: The prefab of the effect to be added
member.returns: True if the effect was added

member.name: M:R2API.EffectAPI.AddEffect(RoR2.EffectDef)
member.summary: Adds an EffectDef to the EffectCatalog when the catalog inits.
member.param: The EffectDef to addZ
member.returns: False if the EffectDef was null

member.name: M:R2API.EliteAPI.Add(R2API.CustomElite)
member.summary: Add a custom item to the list of available elites. Value for EliteDef.eliteIndex can be ignored. If this is called after the ItemCatalog inits then this will return false and ignore the custom elite.
member.param: The elite to add.
member.returns: the EliteIndex of your item if added. -1 otherwise

member.name: T:R2API.CustomElite
member.summary: Class that defines a custom Elite type for use in the game All Elites consistent of an Elite definition, a and a . The equipment is automatically provided to the Elite when it spawns and is configured to passively apply the buff Note that if Elite Spawning Overhaul is enabled, you'll also want to create a EliteAffixCard/ to allow the combat director to spawn your elite type

member.name: F:R2API.CustomElite.EliteDef
member.summary: Elite definition

member.name: M:R2API.CustomElite.#ctor(System.String,RoR2.EquipmentIndex,UnityEngine.Color32,System.String)
member.summary: You can omit the index references for the EliteDef, as those will be filled in automatically by the API. If you are doing an equipment for a custom elite, don't forget to register your CustomEquipment before too to fill the equipmentIndex field !

member.name: M:R2API.CustomElite.#ctor(RoR2.EliteDef)
member.summary: You can omit the index references for the EliteDef, as those will be filled in automatically by the API.

member.summary: Safe way of getting a characters rules, with the promise that the out is always filled.

member.name: M:R2API.LoadoutAPI.AddSkill(System.Type)
member.summary: Adds a type for a skill EntityState to the SkillsCatalog. State must derive from EntityStates.EntityState. Note that SkillDefs and SkillFamiles must also be added seperately.
member.param: The type to add
member.returns: True if succesfully added

member.name: M:R2API.LoadoutAPI.AddSkillDef(RoR2.Skills.SkillDef)
member.summary: Registers an event to add a SkillDef to the SkillDefCatalog. Must be called before Catalog init (during Awake() or OnEnable())
member.param: The SkillDef to add
member.returns: True if the event was registered

member.name: M:R2API.LoadoutAPI.AddSkillFamily(RoR2.Skills.SkillFamily)
member.summary: Registers an event to add a SkillFamily to the SkillFamiliesCatalog Must be called before Catalog init (during Awake() or OnEnable())
member.param: The skillfamily to add
member.returns: True if the event was registered

member.name: M:R2API.LoadoutAPI.CreateSkinIcon(UnityEngine.Color,UnityEngine.Color,UnityEngine.Color,UnityEngine.Color)
member.summary: Creates a skin icon sprite styled after the ones already in the game.
member.param: The color of the top portion
The color of the right portion
The color of the bottom portion
The color of the left portion
member.returns: The icon sprite

member.name: M:R2API.LoadoutAPI.CreateSkinIcon(UnityEngine.Color,UnityEngine.Color,UnityEngine.Color,UnityEngine.Color,UnityEngine.Color)
member.summary: Creates a skin icon sprite styled after the ones already in the game.
member.param: The color of the top portion
The color of the right portion
The color of the bottom portion
The color of the left portion
The color of the dividing lines

member.name: T:R2API.LoadoutAPI.SkinDefInfo
member.summary: A container struct for all SkinDef parameters. Use this to set skinDef values, then call CreateNewSkinDef().

member.name: M:R2API.LoadoutAPI.CreateNewSkinDef(R2API.LoadoutAPI.SkinDefInfo)
member.summary: Creates a new SkinDef from a SkinDefInfo. Note that this prevents null-refs by disabling SkinDef awake while the SkinDef is being created. The things that occur during awake are performed when first applied to a character instead.

member.name: M:R2API.LoadoutAPI.AddSkinToCharacter(UnityEngine.GameObject,R2API.LoadoutAPI.SkinDefInfo)
member.summary: Adds a skin to the body prefab for a character. Will attempt to create a default skin if one is not present. Must be called during plugin Awake or OnEnable. If called afterwards the new skins must be added to bodycatalog manually.
member.param: The body to add the skin to
The SkinDefInfo for the skin to add
member.returns: True if successful

member.name: M:R2API.LoadoutAPI.AddSkinToCharacter(UnityEngine.GameObject,RoR2.SkinDef)
member.summary: Adds a skin to the body prefab for a character. Will attempt to create a default skin if one is not present. Must be called during plugin Awake or OnEnable. If called afterwards the new skins must be added to bodycatalog manually.
member.param: The body to add the skin to
The SkinDef to add
member.returns: True if successful

member.name: M:R2API.LobbyConfigAPI.LobbyCategory.#ctor(System.String,UnityEngine.Color,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a rule category to the lobby.
member.param: The category's title.
The category's color
Should the category be empty, you can show this description.

member.name: M:R2API.LobbyConfigAPI.LobbyCategory.#ctor(RoR2.RuleCategoryDef)
member.summary: Wraps a rule category for the lobby.
member.param: The category.

member.name: M:R2API.LobbyConfigAPI.LobbyCategory.PushRule``1(R2API.LobbyConfigAPI.LobbyRule{``0})
member.summary: Adds a rule to the category. You cannot add choices to that rule after pushing it.
member.param: The rule to add.
member.typeparam: The type of value this rule holds.
member.returns: 'this', for chaining.

member.name: M:R2API.LobbyConfigAPI.LobbyCategory.AddChildCategory(R2API.LobbyConfigAPI.LobbyCategory)
member.summary: Adds a child to this category. The child will get hidden should the parent be collapsed.
member.param: The child.
member.returns: 'this', for chaining.

member.name: P:R2API.LobbyConfigAPI.LobbyRule`1.Value
member.summary: Value of the current choice of the rule.

member.name: E:R2API.LobbyConfigAPI.LobbyRule`1.ValueChanged
member.summary: Gets invoked if the rule is added to a category and the value changed. Sender is 'this', args is 'this.Value'.

member.name: M:R2API.LobbyConfigAPI.LobbyRule`1.#ctor
member.summary: Construct a rule. Does not affect the game until you push the rule to a category.

member.name: M:R2API.LobbyConfigAPI.LobbyRule`1.AddChoice(`0,System.String,System.String,UnityEngine.Color,UnityEngine.Color,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a choice to the rule.
member.param: The value this choice represents.
Tooltip title.
Tooltip description.
A path to the sprite for this choice.
member.returns: 'this', for chaining.

member.name: M:R2API.LobbyConfigAPI.LobbyRule`1.MakeValueDefault(`0)
member.summary: Set the default value for this rule.
member.param: The value for which the choice will be marked as default.
member.returns: 'this', for chaining.

member.name: M:R2API.LobbyConfigAPI.LobbyRule`1.AddChoice(`0,System.String,System.String,UnityEngine.Color,UnityEngine.Color,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a choice to the rule.
member.param: The value this choice represents.
Tooltip title.
Tooltip description.
A path to the sprite for this choice.
An internal name for this choice.
member.returns: 'this', for chaining.

member.name: M:R2API.LobbyConfigAPI.AddCategory(System.String,UnityEngine.Color,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a rule category to the lobby. If a category with the same title already exists, will return that.

The category's color
Should the category be empty, you can show this description.
member.returns: The RuleCategoryDef, keep if you want to add rules.

member.name: M:R2API.LobbyConfigAPI.AddToCategory``1(RoR2.RuleCategoryDef,R2API.LobbyConfigAPI.LobbyRule{``0})
member.summary: Adds a rule to the category. DO NOT ADD CHOICES AFTER THIS.
member.param: The category to add this rule to.
The rule to add.
member.typeparam: The type of value this rule holds.

member.name: T:R2API.ModListAPI
member.summary: An API for sending and retreiving a list of mods (and config settings) in multiplayer.

member.name: F:R2API.ModListAPI.MessageIndex
member.summary: The constant index used by the networkMessages

member.name: F:R2API.ModListAPI.MessageWaitTimeServer
member.summary: The amount of time that the server waits to receive a message before assuming a client is vanilla.

member.name: F:R2API.ModListAPI.MessageWaitTimeClient
member.summary: The amount of time a client waits to receive a message before assuming a server is vanilla.

member.name: P:R2API.ModListAPI.Loaded
member.summary: Is ModListAPI loaded and working?

member.name: P:R2API.ModListAPI.CurrentServerMods
member.summary: The ModList from the current server. null if not connected to a server.

member.name: P:R2API.ModListAPI.ConnectedClientMods
member.summary: A dictionary of ModLists for every connected player (and players who have been connected) by NetworkConnection. null if server inactive.

member.name: E:R2API.ModListAPI.ModListReceivedFromServer
member.summary: An event invoked whenever a server sends its ModList.

member.name: E:R2API.ModListAPI.ModListReceivedFromClient
member.summary: An event invoked whenever a client sends its ModList to server.

member.name: M:R2API.ModListAPI.RebuildModList
member.summary: Must be called any time config values are changed and if (somehow) mods are installed runtime.

member.name: M:R2API.ModListAPI.ModListMessage.#ctor
member.summary: Do not use, must be public for Unity to access.

member.name: M:R2API.ModListAPI.ModListMessage.Serialize(UnityEngine.Networking.NetworkWriter)
member.summary: Do not use, must be public for Unity to access.

member.name: M:R2API.ModListAPI.ModListMessage.Deserialize(UnityEngine.Networking.NetworkReader)
member.summary: Do not use, must be public for Unity to access.

member.name: T:R2API.ModListAPI.ModList
member.summary: A list of mods.

member.name: P:R2API.ModListAPI.ModList.Mods
member.summary: A readonly collection of ModInfos.

member.name: P:R2API.ModListAPI.ModList.IsVanilla
member.summary: Is this modlist empty?

member.name: P:R2API.ModListAPI.ModList.Vanilla
member.summary: An empty modlist

member.name: M:R2API.ModListAPI.ModList.TextRepresentation
member.summary: Get a string of all the mods contained in the list.
member.returns: the string with each mod on its own line

member.name: T:R2API.ModListAPI.ModInfo
member.summary: An entry in a list of mods, represents a single mod.

member.name: P:R2API.ModListAPI.ModInfo.Guid
member.summary: The (hopefully unique) GUID of the mod as a string.

member.name: P:R2API.ModListAPI.ModInfo.Version
member.summary: The version of the Mod

member.name: P:R2API.ModListAPI.ModInfo.HasConfig
member.summary: Does this ModInfo have a config?

member.returns: true if they are the same

member.summary: Checks if two mods are the same, and are the same version

member.summary: Checks if two mods are the same, are the same version, and have the same config settings

member.returns: true if mod, version, and config are the same

member.name: P:R2API.OrbAPI.Loaded
member.summary: Return true if the submodule is loaded.

member.name: M:R2API.OrbAPI.AddOrb(System.Type)
member.summary: Adds an Orb to the orb catalog. This must be called during plugin Awake() or OnEnable(). The type must be a subclass of RoR2.Orbs.Orb
member.param: The type of the orb being added
member.returns: True if orb will be added

member.name: P:R2API.PrefabAPI.Loaded
member.summary: Return true if the submodule is loaded.

member.name: M:R2API.PrefabAPI.InstantiateClone(UnityEngine.GameObject,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Duplicates a GameObject and leaves it in a "sleeping" state where it is inactive, but becomes active when spawned. Also registers the clone to network if registerNetwork is not set to false. Do not override the file, member, and line number parameters. They are used to generate a unique hash for the network ID.
member.param: The GameObject to clone
The name to give the clone (Should be unique)
Should the object be registered to network
member.returns: The GameObject of the clone

member.name: M:R2API.PrefabAPI.RegisterNetworkPrefab(UnityEngine.GameObject,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Registers a prefab so that NetworkServer.Spawn will function properly with it. Only will work on prefabs with a NetworkIdentity component. Is never needed for existing objects unless you have cloned them. Do not override the file, member, and line number parameters. They are used to generate a unique hash for the network ID.
member.param: The prefab to register

member.name: M:R2API.R2API.IsLoaded(System.String)
member.summary: Return true if the specified submodule is loaded.
member.param: nameof the submodule

member.name: T:R2API.ResourcesAPI
member.summary: Allow to register AssetBundles for Mod Makers.

member.name: M:R2API.ResourcesAPI.AddProvider(R2API.IResourceProvider)
member.summary: Add an AssetBundleResourcesProvider to the API. A prefix usually looks like this: "@MyModPrefix" More information on the R2API Wiki.
member.param: assetbundle provider to give, usually made with an AssetBundleResourcesProvider(prefix, assetbundle)

member.name: M:R2API.SkillAPI.AddSkill(System.Type)

member.param: The type to add
member.returns: True if succesfully added

member.param: The skillfamily to add
member.returns: True if the event was registered

member.name: T:R2API.SkinAPI.SkinDefInfo
member.summary: A container struct for all SkinDef parameters. Use this to set skinDef values, then call CreateNewSkinDef().

member.summary: Creates a new SkinDef from a SkinDefInfo. Note that this prevents null-refs by disabling SkinDef awake while the SkinDef is being created. The things that occur during awake are performed when first applied to a character instead.

member.summary: Unloads an bank using the ID (ID is returned at the Add() of the bank)

member.name: P:R2API.SurvivorAPI.Loaded
member.summary: Return true if the submodule is loaded.

member.name: M:R2API.SurvivorAPI.AddSurvivor(RoR2.SurvivorDef)
member.summary: Add a SurvivorDef to the list of available survivors. This must be called before the SurvivorCatalog inits, so before plugin.Start() Value for SurvivorIndex is ignored by game code so can be left blank If this is called after the SurvivorCatalog inits then this will return false and ignore the survivor Can optionally specify a name for the survivor that will be logged with the mod info. The survivor prefab must be non-null
member.param: The survivor to add.
member.returns: true if survivor will be added

member.name: T:R2API.UnbundledResourcesProvider
member.summary: This class allows loading of resources not stored in an assetbundle with Resources.Load. Primary use would be for generating an item icon in code.

member.name: T:R2API.Utils.R2APISubmoduleDependency
member.summary: Attribute to have at the top of your BaseUnityPlugin class if you want to load a specific R2API Submodule. Parameter(s) are the nameof the submodules. e.g: [R2APISubmoduleDependency("SurvivorAPI", "ItemAPI")]

member.name: M:R2API.Utils.APISubmoduleHandler.IsLoaded(System.String)
member.summary: Return true if the specified submodule is loaded.
member.param: nameof the submodule

member.summary: ForEach but with a try catch in it.
member.param: the enumerable object
the action to do on it
the exception dictionary that will get filled, null by default if you simply want to silence the errors if any pop.

member.summary: Send a message to the chat in the format ": "

member.name: M:R2API.Utils.CommandHelper.AddToConsoleWhenReady
member.summary: Scans the calling assembly for ConCommand attributes and Convar fields and adds these to the console. This method may be called at any time.

member.name: M:R2API.Utils.CommandHelper.RegisterCommands(RoR2.Console)
member.summary: Exactly the same as AddToConsoleWhenReady(): use that method instead.

member.name: T:R2API.Utils.DirectMessage

The network connection to send to.

member.name: M:R2API.Utils.DirectMessage.SendDirectMessage(System.String,RoR2.NetworkUser)
member.summary: Sends a string directly to a user. Useful for when you don't want to take advantage of any preformatted string found in RoR2.Chat.
member.param: The message to send
The network user to send to.

member.summary: Sends a ChatMessage directly to a connection. Checkout RoR2.Chat for possible chatmessage types.
member.param: The message to send
The network connection to send to.
